content: A city is planning to upgrade its public transportation system by adding new electric buses to its fleet. The city currently has 150 diesel buses, each with a seating capacity of 50 passengers and an average fuel consumption of 5 miles per gallon. The electric buses have a seating capacity of 60 passengers and can travel up to 200 miles on a single charge. Calculate the number of electric buses needed to replace the entire diesel bus fleet while maintaining the same passenger capacity. Also, estimate the reduction in fuel consumption and greenhouse gas emissions after the transition.

So the city wants to upgrade its public transportation by replacing its diesel buses with electric ones. They've got 150 diesel buses right now, each can carry 50 passengers and they get 5 miles per gallon on average. The electric buses can carry 60 passengers each and can go up to 200 miles on a single charge. The task is to figure out how many electric buses are needed to replace all the diesel buses while keeping the same passenger capacity. Also, we need to estimate how much fuel consumption and greenhouse gas emissions will be reduced after making this switch.

First, I need to understand what "maintaining the same passenger capacity" means. I think it means that the total number of passengers that the bus system can carry shouldn't change after the replacement. So, if they have 150 diesel buses each carrying 50 passengers, the total passenger capacity is 150 times 50, which is 7,500 passengers.

Now, electric buses carry 60 passengers each. So, to carry 7,500 passengers, the number of electric buses needed would be 7,500 divided by 60. Let me do that calculation: 7,500 divided by 60 is 125. So, they would need 125 electric buses to maintain the same passenger capacity.

Next, estimating the reduction in fuel consumption. Since electric buses don't consume fuel in the traditional sense, their "fuel" is electricity, which is different from diesel. So, fuel consumption would effectively reduce by the amount that the diesel buses were consuming.
